posts.post_content:
Posted By: johnny
hello

i have only seen 2 examples...a del howard and i can't remember the other one...just a stab in the dark but looking for a t206 with the name and designee printed in the picture and not in the white border...

email me even if ur not selling, just want to see an example, but ii am willing to purchase!!!

thanks

johnny

Posted By: Art M.
Here is a scan of the T206 Del Howard with name inside the picture.  Wish I owned this one but I do not, sorry Johnny.
Art

[IMG]http://www.network54.com/Realm/tmp/1235933033.JPG[/IMG]

Posted By: Scott Levy
wow!  that is a pretty sweet card!

Posted By: barrysloate
All the dark ink appears to be too high. The collar has a shadow that reaches up to his face; the black vertical stripe on his uniform shirt overlaps his sleeve. What a great card, and I've never seen that error before.

Posted By: john/z28jd
   That Howard card is one of my favorite t206 cards ever. Wish I bought it way back when I had the chance. Good luck JV,If you get one I'll be over to see it the day you get it!

Posted By: marshall barkman
Looks like a blurred overprint in regards to the collar and shirt.

Posted By: johnny
hello all,

if i have not reponded individually, heres my interest..as most of u know i collect these t206 oddities..i had lost this particuliar card to a "whale" of sorts a few years back on ebay, i beleive it went $500...i flubbed and didn't get the ribid...anyway, i'm a sore loser and regret not winning it!!i beleive i have seen  only one other where the name field was close, but not like the del howard....
i have off registers and double exposures of sorts, but none like barry said , where the name was totally shifted...thanks johnny btw,  check out that part sheet # i picked up!!...
i will pay a competitive price..
if anyone has another, please post!!

=   )

johnny

JIM!!

nice sheet # sweet cap back!!!...i have 3 that are just the tip of what looks like a "30"...do u own that card(the one u jus t posted??)

i have seen a cobb w/ a "20" or "30" , these cards are super rare!!!

johnny you have one right???

johnny v

Posted By: johnny
jim,

p.s.

it must be a "30" yours is so clear!!!it must have represented fact 30 on sheets????have ur seen any others jim????????

johnny

Johnny
I do own this card-I just picked it up at a show at my local mall.

Posted By: johnny
Jim!!

awesome card!!what a score, thats the nicest example i've seen so far...

Posted By: Jim Rivera
Johnny

As I said in the other thread on the main board, the dealer was selling his t206s by the fronts. Most had back damage with real nice fronts. He had a stack of 4 that was the Cubs infield. Tinker, Evers, Chance and Steinfeldt. He said he would only sell as a group. I tried to talk him out of the Steinfeldt for an hour with no luck. I went home and grabed about 30 of my rarest 206s and went back and bought the card for 50 bucks after 10 minutes of talking and showing him my cards. 
I think he will be checking backs after we talked.
